publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-734 Trish Godman: Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal—That the Parliament supports the Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal to highlight the importance of giving blood and encourage more donors to come forward and notes that, thanks to the fantastic commitment of approximately 180,000 donors in Scotland, despite constantly struggling to maintain a three-day minimum supply level, the blood transfusion service continues to meet Scottish hospitals’ demand for 1,000 donations of blood every single day.

S3M-734 Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal (lodged on 30 October 2007) Bill Kidd*, John Park*, George Foulkes*, Stuart McMillan*, Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Murray*, Duncan McNeil*, Elaine Smith*, Johann Lamont*, David Stewart*, Nanette Milne*, Elizabeth Smith*, Ross Finnie*, Karen Gillon*, Bill Wilson*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Bashir Ahmad*, Andy Kerr*
S3M-734 Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal (lodged on 30 October 2007) Mary Mulligan*, Kenneth Gibson*, Gil Paterson*, Hugh Henry*

S3M-734 Trish Godman: Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal—That the Parliament supports the Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal to highlight the importance of giving blood and encourage more donors to come forward and notes that, thanks to the fantastic commitment of approximately 180,000 donors in Scotland, despite constantly struggling to maintain a three-day minimum supply level, the blood transfusion service continues to meet Scottish hospitals’ demand for 1,000 donations of blood every single day. Supported by: Bill Kidd, John Park, George Foulkes, Stuart McMillan, Jackie Baillie, Elaine Murray, Duncan McNeil, Elaine Smith, Johann Lamont, David Stewart, Nanette Milne, Elizabeth Smith, Ross Finnie, Karen Gillon, Bill Wilson, Hugh O’Donnell, Bashir Ahmad, Andy Kerr, Mary Mulligan, Kenneth Gibson, Gil Paterson, Hugh Henry
S3M-734 Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal (lodged on 30 October 2007) Lewis Macdonald*
S3M-734 Greenock Telegraph’s Blood Donor Appeal (lodged on 30 October 2007) Ken Macintosh*
